content.text:
# List of Czech European Film Award winners and nominees

This is a list of Czech European Film Award winners and nominees. This list details the performances of Czech actors, actresses, and films that have either been submitted or nominated for, or have won, a European Film Award.
Main categories
{| class="wikitable" width="100%" cellpadding="5"
|-
!width="5%"|Year
!width="18%"|Award
!width="28%"|Recipient
!width="10%"|Status
!width="38%"|Note
|-
|rowspan="2"| 1996 || Best Film || Kolya ||  || Czech-French-British co-production
|-
| Best Film || Lea ||  || German-Czech co-production
|-
|rowspan="2"|  2006 || People's Choice Award for Best Film || Something Like Happiness ||  || Czech-German co-production
|-
| People's Choice Award for Best Film || Oliver Twist ||  || British-Czech-French-Italian co-production
|-
|rowspan="2"| 2007 || Best Film || La Vie En Rose ||  || French-Czech-British co-production
|-
| People's Choice Award for Best Film || I Served the King of England ||  || Czech-Slovak-German-Hungarian co-production
|-
|  2009 || People's Choice Award for Best Film || The Baader Meinhof Complex ||  || German-French-Czech co-production
|-
| 2012 || Best Animated Feature Film || Alois Nebel ||  || Czech-German co-production
|-
|}

* [http://www.europeanfilmacademy.org/ Nominees and winners] at the European Film Academy website
